issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Recent development in Druid introduced new semantic of null handling [here|https://github.com/b-slim/druid/commit/219e77aeac9b07dc20dd9ab2dd537f3f17498346]

Based on those changes when need to honer push down of expressions with is null/ is not null predicates.
The prosed fix overrides the mapping of Calcite Function to Druid Expression to much the correct semantic.
fields.summary: Proper handling of is null and not is null predicate when pushed to Druid
Follow up of HIVE-19615, use UnaryFunction instead of prefix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

I don't recall exactly but I have looked at the errors and seems unrelated, will let [~ashutoshc] revert if needed.

[~jcamachorodriguez] which branch are you using to reproduce the Druid failure ? i can not reproduced it locally and that test did not fail prior merging this.

In any case, patches cannot be committed without +1 from QA. The vote [~hagleitn] was referring to:
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hive-dev/201805.mbox/%3C75DCEC8A-9C05-46F4-B39D-63C201FD20DB@apache.org%3E
[~bslim], failure is due to renaming of tables in q test files, {{druid_table}} no longer exists, you can use master to reproduce it locally.
[~jcamachorodriguez] let me know when is it reverted
I have already reverted it.

Sorry about the failures and thanks for reverting.
Last test run was 4 days ago and I thought it indicated a good run but alas other changes went in (renaming of table name), nullifying results of that run. 
To avoid such issues in future, we need gerrit like system which also merges the changes as soon as all criteria for commits are met (like +1 from reviewer, +1 from Hive QA etc).  That will also prevent cases where committers forget to commit patches after giving +1 but Hive QA has not run yet.  I have seen both of these issues in past.
Perhaps, we can enhance our ptest infra to do this.

| (/) *{color:green}+1 overall{color}* |
